greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 5^n mod 7.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,0,-1,1).
mathematica: PowerMod[5, Range[0, 110], 7] (* or *) LinearRecurrence[{1, 0, -1, 1}, {1, 5, 4, 6}, 110] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Apr 26 2011 *)
PadRight[{}, 100, {1, 5, 4, 6, 2, 3}] (* or *) CoefficientList[Series[(1 + 5 x + 4 x^2 + 6 x^3 + 2 x^4 + 3 x^5) / (1 - x^6), {x, 0, 100}], x] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Mar 24 2016 *)
program: (MAGMA) [Modexp(5, n, 7): n in [0..100]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Mar 24 2016 - after _Bruno Berselli_
xref: Cf. A178229 (decimal expansion of (221+11*sqrt(1086))/490), A178141 (repeat 4, -1, 2, -4, 1, -2), A117373 (repeat 1, -2, -3, -1, 2, 3), A153727 (trajectory of 3x+1 sequence starting at 1).
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 12 2002
